message_1: An RSA encryption key has been generated with the values of p=31 and q=37. Find the RSA modulus and the totient of the RSA modulus.
message_2:
To find the RSA modulus (n), we simply multiply the two prime numbers p and q:

n = p * q
n = 31 * 37
n = 1147

Now, to find the totient of the RSA modulus (φ(n)), we use the formula:

φ(n) = (p - 1) * (q - 1)
φ(n) = (31 - 1) * (37 - 1)
φ(n) = 30 * 36
φ(n) = 1080

So, the RSA modulus is 1147 and the totient of the RSA modulus is 1080.
